alert.note: Alert for Southeast Elbert County Below 6000 Feet, South Lincoln County (Colorado) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Red Flag Warning issued February 27 at 11:20AM MST until February 28 at 6:00PM MST by NWS Boulder
info.description: ...Critical Fire Weather Conditions Tuesday in southern Lincoln County... .Strong westerly winds will develop late Tuesday morning and continue throughout the afternoon, with gusts likely to exceed 40 mph combining with low daytime humidity. Given recent snowmelt in the area, this will lead to high fire danger for several hours. ...RED FLAG WARNING IN EFFECT FROM 11 AM TO 6 PM MST TUESDAY FOR WIND AND LOW RELATIVE HUMIDITY FOR SOUTHERN LINCOLN COUNTY AND SOUTHEASTERN ELBERT COUNTY... The National Weather Service in Denver has issued a Red Flag Warning for wind and low relative humidity, which is in effect from 11 AM to 6 PM MST Tuesday. * Affected Area...Fire Weather Zone 247. * Timing...11 AM Tuesday to 6 PM Tuesday. * Winds...West 25 to 35 mph with gusts up to 55 mph. * Relative Humidity...13 to 18%. * Impacts...Conditions will be favorable for rapid fire spread. Avoid outdoor burning and any activities that may produce sparks.
info.instruction: A Red Flag Warning means that critical fire weather conditions are either occurring now....or will shortly. A combination of strong winds...low relative humidity...and warm temperatures can contribute to extreme fire behavior.

area.areaDesc: Southeast Elbert County Below 6000 Feet, South Lincoln County
